content: I am new to this chat. I'm an internal medicine physician who knows how to make some applications using technologies like the MEAN stack and Flutter. I've gone through the HL7 FHIR intermediate course but I'm just getting started with FHIR and hoping to make some FHIR applications. I was just wondering if anyone has any advice for me getting started creating a SMART on FHIR app.
Best place to ask is probably on the #smart stream. And welcome :)
I don't think we have a stream for flutter, but there are some people interested in it

@Michael Albrecht You would be very welcome on the FHIR-FLI Slack group which is run by @Grey Faulkenberry and @John Manning . All Flutter developers, including many clinicians, developing healthcare apps with FHIR. Grey has also built a Flutter library called "fhir_auth" which can turn your native app into a Smart on FHIR app. I have baked this into a questionnaire filler that can send its questionnaire responses from protected FHIR endpoints (see https://github.com/tiloc/faiadashu). Check out https://github.com/MayJuun/fhir for details on Flutter FHIR libraries and info on how to contact Grey and the Slack group.
